Evaluation_Questions: How well did this course, to the extent promised in the syllabus, enable “conversation across lines of difference,” integrate practical and theoretical concerns, or consider and integrate issues of class, gender/sexuality, race/ethnicity, dis/ability, and or global/cultural diversity
Comments_Questions: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your Teaching Fellow as an instructor and how might his/her teaching be improved
What was the name of your practicum instructor
What were her/his strengths or weaknesses
Comments_List:
Prepared and detail oriented. Attended to all questions. 
Didnt always have the direction from professor before section to answer some questions. Always communicated and resolved our concerns.

Highly knowledgeable of the material
Previous education/training was very apparent and beneficial to discussion sections

Yoni was absolutely amazing!! He's one of the best TF's I have ever had. He is an exceptional facilitator. He makes everyone feels welcome and encourages everyone to engage at a very deep level. He was very sensitive to diversity and helping us think critically about our beliefs. He would make an awesome professor! Also he was very prompt in getting our grades back and gave us very helpful feedback. He was always available for help outside of the classroom.
Not practicum but small group - she was incredible!!! She was very encouraging and available to students.
Emilie is very knowledgable, smart and collaborative.  Her sections were very well organized and she encouraged participation while excellently guiding the conversations.

Emilie was an enthusiastic, knowledgeable, and helpful TF. She facilitated discussion well during sections and had plenty of insights to add to help students think further about the text and Biblical interpretation. Emilie was also an efficient grader of assignments and had all work back promptly.
As Emilie continues to grow as a teacher, I would encourage her to consider drawing more voices into class discussion by occasionally calling on people in section. Doing so would create a more robust conversation.

Yoni's teaching, both in class and in section, was outstanding. His points were very clear, his arguments very convincing and his answers to questions very helpful. He made himself very much available for the students and cared about what they learned and what they thought. Sections always felt very short because of well everybody was engaged and thanks to the thought-provoking questions he was asking.
It is quite impressive how fast the mid-term, exegesis paper and final exam were graded. Comments were also very helpful.
She facilitated interesting discussions and was available to discuss anything that we might need to talk about.
